Summary.name: Sample Introduction
Summary.content: Welcome to the Sample API documentation. This API demonstrates basic CRUD operations for a user management system.

Summary.name: Authentication
Summary.content:
Most endpoints require authentication. To authenticate, obtain a JWT token by logging in via the /api/v1/auth/login endpoint. Include this token in the Authorization header of your requests:

Authorization: Bearer <your_token_here>

Summary.name: Common Use Cases
Rate Limiting
Summary.content: Our API implements rate limiting to ensure fair usage. You are limited to 100 requests per minute. If you exceed this limit, you'll receive a 429 Too Many Requests response.

Summary.name: Errors
Summary.content:
The API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general:
- 2xx range indicate success
- 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, etc.)
- 5xx range indicate an error with our servers

Summary.name: Support
Summary.content: If you have any questions or need assistance, please contact our support team at api-support@example.com.

Users.name: Get All Users
Users.description: Retrieve a list of all users

Users.name: Get User
Users.description: Retrieve details of a specific user

Users.name: Update User
Users.description: Update details of a specific user
